DOC.brief_summary: This study investigate efficacy safety administration multiple dos intravenous ( IV ) acetaminophen ( IVAPAP ) 48 hour period follow Gynecologic Surgery .
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Safety Intravenous Acetaminophen Over 48 Hrs Treatment Post-op Pain After Gynecologic Surgery
DOC.detailed_description: The research hypothesis IV Acetaminophen provide great reduction pain intensity great pain relief moderate severe pain compare placebo 48 hour follow surgery .
DOC.criteria: Undergo gynecologic surgery use standard abdominal approach midline Pfannenstiel incision 1875 year age Body Mass Index ( BMI ) 1945 American Society Anesthesiologists ( ASA ) risk class I , II , III Not receive neuraxial ( spinal epidural ) opioid analgesic prior surgery Moderate Severe pain rest Requires additional surgical procedure either relate unrelated gynecologic surgery hospitalization Procedures involve minimal incision laparotomy , laparoscopy , supraumbilical Maylard incision Has know hypersensitivity opioids , acetaminophen , excipients IV acetaminophen Known history alcohol drug abuse misuse Has impair liver function Aspartate transaminase ( AST ) , Alanine aminotransferase ( ALT ) , bilirubin great equal 2 time upper limit normal Has significant medical disease ( ) , condition may contraindicate participation study Has participate another clinical trial within 30 day surgery
